titleStmt.title: Q. Horatius Flaccus: his Art of poetry. Englished by Ben: Jonson. With other workes of the author, never printed before
Ars poetica. English
titleStmt.author: Horace.
Jonson, Ben, 1573?-1637. Ben: Jonson's execration against Vulcan.
Marshall, William, fl. 1617-1650, engraver.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by I. Okes, for Iohn Benson,

notesStmt.note: With an additional title page, engraved, signed "W.M. sculpsit" (i.e. William Marshall), with imprint "London. Printed for John Benson. 1640". Variant 1: this imprint reads "London. Printed for J. Benson and are sold by W. Ley at Paules-Chayne. 1640".

"Ben: Ionson's execration against Vulcan", "The masque of the gypsies", and "Epigrams to severall noble personages in this kingdome" each have separate dated title page; pagination and register are continuous. "Vulcan" and "Epigrams" are reprinted from "Ben: Jonsons execration against Vulcan", 1640.
The first leaf and the last leaf are blank; the second bears an imprimatur.
D6-10 and E5-11 are cancelled by gatherings d¹² and e¹² respectively. Variant 2: cancellanda present.
"The masque" identified as STC 14777a, and "Epigrams" as STC 14765, on UMI microfilm reel 757.
Reproduction of the originals in the British Library and the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
Appears at reel 757 (British Library copy, "The masque" and "Epigrams" only) and at reel 1208 (Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery copy).
